DOC.brief_summary: This study aim compare efficacy nasal provocation test Lysine-Acetylsalicylate patient history NSAIDs hypersensitivity mucocutaneous symptom respiratory symptom laboratory outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Nasal Provocation Test With Lysine-Acetylsalicylate ( ASA ) Patients With Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs ( NSAIDs ) Hypersensitivity
DOC.criteria: Patients history ASA/NSAIDs hypersensitivity mucocutaneous symptom and/or respiratory symptom Patients discontinue drug test follow Nasal corticosteroids/Oral corticosteroids/Leukotriene modifier 1 week Shortacting antihistamines 3 day Nasal amimetics/Oral amimetics/Local cromones 24 hour Contraindicated nasal provocation test : pregnant , exacerbation allergic rhinitis/asthma , upper respiratory tract infection within 2 week prior test , nose surgery within 8 week prior test , severe systemic disease ( ) Having factor interfere nasal provocation test LysineASA massive nasal polyp , nasal septal perforation , total nasal obstruction least 1 nostril
